column3: Yeah, this relies on the "synchronisation-effect" of `assert_debug_log`, which I generally dislike because it makes tests harder to read. Though, I couldn't find another solution without modifying bitcoind.

Code review ACK fab1eb65b196d62466fdc2ed319ffa19d3560a0c\n\nI don't have any problem using `assert_debug_log` for synchronization. Maybe it could be more apparent by having an explicitly named function (or add a comment?) that synchronizes on a debug log message, but I *like* using a trigger on process output for synchronization instead of say, polling RPC in a loop.
